articles.title: Eliud Kipchoge beats his own marathon world record by 30 seconds – video - The Guardian
articles.description: Kenya’s Eliud Kipchoge shattered his own marathon world record by 30 seconds, winning the Berlin event with a time of two hours, one minute and nine seconds.
